definition: family history (as a literary genre)
handed down in a family/family traditions

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
biography/historical narrative/commentaries/relay station
to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)

sentences.english: I heritate the royal blood family.
sentences.chinese: 精忠的赤血點染了我的家傳。

sentences.english: Still bore ( the family) arms, and had for his crest a cock argent.
sentences.chinese: 他仍然帶着家傳的武器，頭盔上飾有一隻銀雞。

sentences.english: Since 1973, their family a traditional flavored Laksa.
sentences.chinese: 家傳着1973年至今的古早味辣沙。

sentences.english: Now it looks as if it might be part of the original family recipe.
sentences.chinese: 目前看來，它可能早已是人們家傳食物祕方的一部分。
